Description: Scarab made of glazed steatite, most part of the back is chipped of. Whitish-beige colour with incised lines filled with dark turquoise to green glaze. The division between head and prothorax is shown with a single line. The division between prothorax and elytra is shown in a single line. No suture visible anymore but the break might indicate there was one originally. The head is shown with a single line, both eyes indicated by incised lines. The clypeus is not indicated. The side of the scarab shows all three legs roughly cut on top of a base plate. The seal at the base shows a roughly cut oval line framing the base, inside on the left a seated deity with a possible mAa.t-feather on the head, facing to the right. In front of mAa.t a crude ankh-sing? The longitudinal perforation is fully preserved.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 24)
